result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
State moves to dismiss and read in both counts.  The defendant plead to charges in 15 CF 711.  Motion granted.
Minutes.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

This case riding along with 15 CF 711.
Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with D.A. is set for 04-12-16 at 2:00 p.m.
Plea date is set for 06-24-16 at 9:00 a.m.
Minutes.

Case riding along with 15 CF 711.
Attorney Belville was just appointed and requests an adjournment.
Hearing reset for 03-11-16 at 8:30 a.m.
Minutes.

Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.   Preliminary hearing on 15 CF 711 set for 01-08-16 at 9:00 a.m.     
Minutes.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess illegally obtained prescription, theft by fraud, PTC theft by fraud, burglary, theft from vehicle, misappropriate ID information, receive stolen property and obstruct officer.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 12-14-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no contact with Casey Scherer and Judith Engelbrecht or her residence at 910 S. 39th Street, Manitowoc, WI.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
